availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Ewing (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster.)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Jane Boxley in Warren County, Kentucky, on February 5, 1838. Father of Mary A. Ewing, Julia Ewing, John W. Ewing, Susan E. Ewing, Henry A. Ewing, Boxley S. Ewing, and Clara Ewing. Resident of Warren County in 1840. Owned five enslaved people in Warren County in 1840. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned six enslaved people in Warren County in 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned five enslaved people in Warren County in 1860. Appointed postmaster of Bristow Station on July 29, 1862.
